climbs.name: Tunnel Vision
climbs.fa: Dave Cardosa, Scott Harris and Hank Caylor, 1988

content.description: Wow! Lots of pumpy fun on this one!  It's on you pretty much the whole way with some great holds and good rails to rest on (good luck with that).  Crux comes at the top when you're good and pumped!
content.location: To the right of Through the Looking Glass, these two routes are the first two climbs you see when you scrabble up the 6-8ft ledge from the right.

climbs.name: Through the Looking Glass
climbs.fa: Dave Cardosa, Scott Harri, Greg Brooks, 1988

content.description: I've always liked this climb, its got some diversity.  Start off with optional campus moves and pull up and stand on the ledge from there move up and a little left.  You get another huge ledge rest before moving out right and over the bulge (so fun!).
content.location: To the left of tunnel vision, there's a level split on the great wall and this climb is the first climb on the upper level.  starting just to the left of a small tree-ish thing growing out of the rock.

content.description: The crux is the bottom half.  I recommend stick clipping the first bolt, otherwise you might end up flying over the big ledge you started on.  Dyno to good jug in the beginning, work through some pockets and crimps, then finish up on jugs.  Top out is pretty loose so be careful.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 1 pin.  If you clip the pin, longer draw would be better.  you dont really need the pin because you are on jugs when you clip it, then you stand up on those jugs and theres a bolt in your face.
content.location: 2 routes to the right of Tunnel Vision.  Starts in the obvious roof with first bolt just over the lip.

content.description: This route is a linkup: begin with the first two bolts of Power Monkey (PM) then finish leftward on Tunnel Vision (TV).  This is a higher quality route than PM in my humble opinion, and these days it sees more action than PM.  After the PM crux, I traversed on the jugs just below the third bolt of TV and then clipped said bolt.  There was definite ground fall potential. It appears you could move left earlier to the flat ledge below the second bolt on TV.  A long runner on that bolt would prevent any drag and the safety factor would be improved.  I would say this linkup adds quality without significantly increasing the difficulty of PM.  Try it!
content.protection: 4-5 bolts, depending on how you clip, to sport anchors. I suggest stick clipping #2 of PM to a prevent ground fall while clipping. The safest option is to then clip #2 of TV with a long runner. If you connect at #3 of TV, rehearse the moves first as you could face a dangerous ground fall while clipping. Remember, limestone is a soft rock, and even well traveled Greenbelt routes exfoliate regularly.
content.location: Start on the dusty ledge to the right of Tunnel Vision and to the left of Space Cowboy

climbs.name: Power Monkey
climbs.fa: Dave Cardosa, Scott Harris and Hank

content.description: The quintessential tweaky Greenbelt route. A 2 bolt V5/6 overhung crimp problem to a good rest followed by some weird vertical climbing. Start on the dusty ledge. Don't even bother to wipe your feet because the next shelf is made of dust too. Â The crux is fingery and cryptic. It will test your dedication.
content.protection: Stick clip number 2 to prevent a ground fall
content.location: The bolt line to the right of tunnel vision and to the left of space cowboy

climbs.name: Iron Man
climbs.fa: Scott Harris, Dave Cardosa, Greg Brooks, 1988

content.description: Crux is getting to and over the roof, on a hot humid Austin day this is gonna be hard (greasy).  This is kind of a one section wonder as it finishes easy 9/10- climbing to chains...
content.protection: 5 bolts with chains (might use a longer one under the roof or down climb and unclip).
content.location: Look for a dihedral under a roof between Disneyland (13b) and Peewee's Big Adventure (11c that shares first bolt of Iron Man and traverses right).

content.description: One of the 2 "hard" 5.12s in the area. Has 5.10 moves to attain the first bolt. Then hard moves under the roof with an awkward clip of the 3rd bolt to begin the 1st crux. Move up and out of that roof to the smaller roof to set up for the 2nd crux.
content.location: Left side of the great wall under a large roof

content.description: FA'ed BITD with poor protection. Glue-ins and upgraded anchors were installed March 14, 2019. Begin on the first 3 bolts of Heaven's Gate, then clip a new glue-in in the roof. Pull the roof and then climb the headwall ( clipping another new glue-in) to get to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolted hangers then 2 glue-ins to new sport anchors
content.location: The start is marked by the double bolted hangers at the bottom of Heaven's Gate.

content.description: Hard moves over the 1st bolt is the first crux. Then traverse right under the roof to exit on the right side of the Hug Thy Mother route. Possible double knee bar and another crux on thin crimps to the same anchor as Hug
content.protection: sport bolted, use long draws or bring 24" runners for the 3 bolts on the traverse to lower rope drag
content.location: Far left side of the Great Wall. To the right of Cactus Patch. The 1st bolt has 2 bolted hangers, one is old with an allen bolt. see photo.

climbs.name: Fook You AKA Don't Hurt the Rock

content.description: Old "bandit" route that had a runout has been rehabilitated. New Glue-in added in the triangle roof to protect the move under the roof and the moves out of the roof to the last bolt. Sport Anchors added, as well.
content.protection: 4 bolted hangers, then 1 glue-in, then 1 more bolted hanger then t sport anchors
content.location: Located at the Great Wall, uses the first 3 bolts of Pee Wee's Big Adventure.

content.protection: 5 bolts, shares the anchor with Iron Man   Hardware was upgraded March of 2010
content.location: The route just left of Iron Man

content.description: Doesn't get much traffic. Goes straight up. Hard moves that require reach right off the ground. Then ok hard moves out the roof and finish on Pee wee's 2nd crux.
content.protection: 3 ClimbTech Gluein Bolts added Oct 28, 2018. Stick clip the first bolt as getting to it is the crux.
content.location: Left of Through the Looking Glass. Locate the start under the single lonesome piton under the roof

content.description: Great climbing at harder grades than anywhere else on the Greenbelt.  Best in late fall to late winter when there's no humidity.  Expect to see people (not necessarily crowds) on the weekends and certain nights of the week but most of the time it's not too crowded.  A bit polished as are most of the routes that see a lot of action on the Greenbelt but it's climbing and there's some good moves and positions as well as power climbs to be done here!
